root: ^I close the door with my back at it. The knee buckles.

c-0: ^I instinctively wriggle my fingers. The bear took a piece of my arm but most of me has made it here. At the edge of the world, only wilderness beyond...
g-1: ^As I take the hood down and wipe off the flakes of snow from my face, a fully lit tavern appears.

^Laughter from a table is drowned by an argument on another. A roar of Huzzah accompanies raised goblets around the fireplace. Is that him? I take a small step towards him. He begins to flicker away. I reach out and grasp nothing. Silence calls his name.
g-2: ^I read the letter in my trembling hand again.

^"Nothing like sitting by the fire after a trek to the Untamed Lands. Only thing warmer is your onion soup. You got to make that when I am back". I trudge past the dead embers in the fireplace. The leg hurts and I stumble.

c-4: ^ Thud. The world fades in and out.

c-0: ^ I embrace the light and only feel coldness.

get_up: ^ a stool. Kegs of ale marked "Golden Liquid" linger under the bar. "Goes down like milk. Hits like a brick. Only found at the Last Hearth. I will bring you a bottle. And no, I am not just drowning my life in alcohol. Can you not?"
^I try the Golden Liquid. Another swig. Another page.

g-0: ^"They have found a new kind of mud. It should help with the leaky roof. I will bring some." The letter slips from my hand, settles on the counter. I expect to see it littered with tears. Instead the tears are on my cheek.
g-1: ^The empty bottle rolls off the bar. The darkness has thickened. I get a second bottle and read again.

look_up: ^A silhouette stands in the open door.

b: ^The stranger slowly drifts towards me while unravelling the garb hiding their face.

door_close: ^ A wrinkled face fenced by a gray mane reveals the scars of many fights. One in particular has left a deep gash across the left eye. "I had heard The Last Hearth had been abandoned". His accent is unfamiliar, maybe Eastern.

g-1: ^"Guess I heard wrong. I also heard there was still some Golden Liquid available. I see that bit is true".

c-1: ^ I pour him a drink with a steady hand.

g-2: ^I lose into my drink. A thud brings me back. The stranger's gone. A pair of coins glint on the counter.
